results.title: Privacy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A journalist comes across certain documents which could be embarrassing - or worse - to a public figure. Should he disclose the contents of these papers? Moderated by Arthur Miller.

results.title: Fairness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A television company proposes to make a documentary about economic exploitation and police brutality in a foreign country. It has already made two such programs - is it fair to make a third? And should the reporter sent to investigate be known to have strong personal opinions on the subject? Narrated by Jeremy Isaacs.
results.description:

results.title: Official information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A journalist comes across a confidential government paper concerning major, but controversial, tradedeal for Britain. The government asks for its publication to be delayed. What does the newspaper do? Moderated by Paul Sieghart.

results.title: Ideas of their own
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The most significant development of the child in his third year is his use of language. His mother can help him greatly by talking and listening to him, reading stories and nursery rhymes and sharing picture books. At this age a child develops an increased sense of his own identity, words such as ‘you’ and ‘I’, ‘yours’ and ‘mine’ take on meaning.

results.title: Rising two
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”
At this stage the child grows fast and progresses from crawling to running, and from single syllables to short sentences. He begins to play imaginative games and to understand the use of symbols. He is able to look back to the past or forward to the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Inger, Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Pre-School child
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The year before school starts is full of opportunity: the four year old is manually more dexterous, and physically more adventurous than the three year old. He cooperates with others, concentrates more and undertakes responsibility for specific tasks.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.

results.title: Playing together
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
Scenes from the many sports played in Britain, stressing the need for the young to have opportunities to learn to play sport and its value as a character builder.
